result.execSummary:
This case is being appealed. If the court makes a decision in a case that a party disagrees with, the party may have the right to seek review by a higher court to determine if the trial court's decision was correct. Appeals are most often made after a trial or final decision in a case, but an appeal can also occur before a final decision.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

3:58 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson in court for Theon Wyatt Mullinax. Defendant Theon Wyatt Mullinax in court, in custody. Victim Witness in Court. Court reviews case. Court notes examiner for Examination. Attys agreed on 3 examiners. Court addresses request for atty fees. Atty Harrelson will be keeping file. Atty Harrelson makes bond argument. ADA Ballo objects to modification. Court requests additional information re: living and transportation. Adjourned 04:06 PM

Defendant Theon Wyatt Mullinax in court, in custody. Victim Witness in Court. Court reviews case. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waives further reading. NG to all counts and NG due to mental defect. Court orders NGI. Atty Harrelson makes bond modification request. ADA Damrau objects to bond modification. Court does not modify bond at this time. Court sets BBH.

Attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson in court for Theon Wyatt Mullinax. Defendant Theon Wyatt Mullinax in court, in custody. Victim Witness in court. Victim in court. Court reviews case. within three business days of this order, the appellant shall advise
1.) the court reporter what transcripts he deems necessary to prosecute his motion for relief pending appeal. 2.) the time to file the transcripts is extended to fourteen days after the appellant provides the court reporter with the list of transcripts necessary to the pending motion for relief pending appeal. 3.) the appellant's memorandum in support of his motion for relief pending appeal shall be due eleven days after the transcripts are filed. 4.) the State's response to the motion for relief pending appeal shall be due eleven days after the appellant's memorandum is filed. 04:03 PM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. ADA: Holly Elkin Rockow, DF ATTY: Jeremiah James Harrelson, DF: Theon Wyatt Mullinax appeared from Jail. Victim witness appeared with Victim. Court reviews case. Atty Harrelson states DE wishes to challenge Competency Exam. Court addresses DE. DE states he is Competent. Atty Harrelson request Dr. Minter to appear via zoom for testimony. Atty Rockow request to proceed with Dr. Minter's report. JA tried contacting Dr. Minter. JA left Voicemail and sent Email re: Appearing today. Dr. Minter appeared via zoom at 04:15 PM. S/T Dr. Donna Minter. Direct by ADA Rockow. Cross by Atty Harrelson. Court questions Dr. Minter. Recross by Atty Harrelson. Dr. Minter excused. Attorney arguments. Side Bar. Court continues hearing. Court sets CH. Adjourned 05:14 PM  Competency hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Filed by Dr. Minter. km             to rg

CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:   Michelle P Brekken   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Theon Wyatt Mullinax appeared from jail via video. Case called at 1:20 p.m. Atty Harrelson states DE qualifies for PD services. Argues bond. Requesting bond be reduced. DE is considering Grace Place for alternate residence. Collects SSI payments. ADA Brekken objects. No open cases. Recites criminal history. Atty Harrelson is not aware if DE has connections to mental health services. Court will have Kara R. to meet with DE to discuss programming. DE is willing to meet with her. Does take medication for mental health and has a primary physician. ADA Brekken takes a moment to speak with Victims. SIDE BAR. Case recalled at 1:34 p.m. Court addresses concerns of housing, medications and mental health. Court will reverse decision, original bond remains. Court raises competency. Orders examination. DE to remain in custody until exam has been completed.
Bail/bond hearing on May 27, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:  Michelle P Brekken   DF ATTY: Kaitlin Dipploito and Travis Satorius   DF:  Theon Wyatt Mullinax appeared from jail via video. Case called at 1:44 p.m. Court scheduled this matter for a bail bond hearing to see if DE contacted PD's Office. Atty Dippolito did not meet with DE. Was not aware. Court will reset to tomorrow. Atty Harrelson will meet with DE tomorrow.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Pretrial Assessment Report. SEALED w/ acces to parties.  gll

ADDRESS INFO for Theon Wyatt Mullinax
Current: 1101 Carmichael Road, c/o St. Croix County Jail, Hudson, WI 54016 United States  (Effective: 05-23-2022)
Prior: 848 Yellowstone Trail, #206, Hudson, WI 54016
Filed by DA's Office. km
Bail/bond hearing on May 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Jayne M., Serenity M., or 848 Yellowstone Trail, Hudson, WI 54016.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Comply with mental health treatment plan.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.
